intro: Connarus patrisii, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and woody, thorny stems. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine.
